Function Documentation

int x509_self_test ( int  verbose  ) 

Checkup routine.

Returns:
0 if successful, or 1 if the test failed

int x509parse_crt ( x509_cert *  crt,
unsigned char *  buf,
int  buflen 
)

Parse one or more certificates and add them to the chained list.

Parameters:
chain points to the start of the chain
buf buffer holding the certificate data
buflen size of the buffer
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code

int x509parse_crtfile ( x509_cert *  crt,
char *  path 
)

Load one or more certificates and add them to the chained list.

Parameters:
chain points to the start of the chain
path filename to read the certificates from
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code

int x509parse_key ( rsa_context *  rsa,
unsigned char *  buf,
int  buflen,
unsigned char *  pwd,
int  pwdlen 
)

Parse a private RSA key.

Parameters:
rsa RSA context to be initialized
buf input buffer
buflen size of the buffer
pwd password for decryption (optional)
pwdlen size of the password
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code

int x509parse_keyfile ( rsa_context *  rsa,
char *  path,
char *  password 
)

Load and parse a private RSA key.

Parameters:
rsa RSA context to be initialized
path filename to read the private key from
pwd password to decrypt the file (can be NULL)
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code

int x509parse_verify ( x509_cert *  crt,
x509_cert *  trust_ca,
char *  cn,
int *  flags 
)

Verify the certificate signature.

Parameters:
crt a certificate to be verified
trust_ca the trusted CA chain
cn expected Common Name (can be set to NULL if the CN must not be verified)
flags result of the verification
Returns:
0 if successful or XYSSL_ERR_X509_SIG_VERIFY_FAILED, in which case *flags will have one or more of the following values set: BADCERT_EXPIRED -- BADCERT_REVOKED -- BADCERT_CN_MISMATCH -- BADCERT_NOT_TRUSTED
Note:
TODO: add two arguments, depth and crl

int x509write_add_pubkey ( x509_raw *  crt,
rsa_context *  pubkey 
)

Add a public key to certificate.

Parameters:
chain points to the raw certificate data
pubkey points to an RSA key
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code

int x509write_create_selfsign ( x509_raw *  crt,
rsa_context *  raw 
)

Create a self-signed certificate.

Parameters:
chain points to the raw certificate data
rsa a private key to sign the certificate
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code

int x509write_create_subject ( x509_raw *  crt,
unsigned char *  names 
)

Create x509 subject field to raw certificate.

Parameters:
chain points to the raw certificate data
names a string that can hold: CN='CommonName' -- O='Organization' -- OU='OrgUnit' -- ST='State' -- L='Locality' -- R='Email'
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code

int x509write_create_validity ( x509_raw *  crt,
unsigned char *  before,
unsigned char *  after 
)

Create x509 validity time in UTC.

Parameters:
chain points to the raw certificate data
before valid not before in format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
after valid not after in format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code

int x509write_crtfile ( x509_raw *  crt,
unsigned char *  path,
int  out_flag 
)

Write a certificate info file.

Parameters:
chain points to the raw certificate data
path filename to write the certificate to
format X509_OUTPUT_DER or X509_OUTPUT_PEM
Returns:
0 if successful, or a specific X509 error code
